title.narrative: UNDP Climate Smart Bio-Waste Managment Challenge
UNDP Utmaningsdriven klimatinnovation för ökad biologiskt återvinning

description.narrative: The “Climate Smart Bio-Waste Management Challenge” project supports the reduction of the quantity of biowaste disposed on landfills that leads to the decrease of greenhouse gases emission and consequently reduction of environmental pollution. The project initiate a Challenge based call for proposals of the business solutions and innovative projects that can contribute to creative ways of reduction, reuse and recycling of bio-waste in the Republic of Serbia, while at the same time preventing landfilling and reducing greenhouse gasses emissions. Besides this, the Project will assist the Government of the Republic of Serbia to divert a bio-waste fraction of communal waste from landfilling and boost local economies and businesses that are based on sustainable and circular solutions. Significant efforts will be invested in transferring the lessons learned and knowledge generated throughout the project implementation to enable benefits for the wider group of stakeholders. Also, the Project is expected to raise the interest of the waste generators, operators and Public Utility Companies in creating their own sustainable waste management models based on replication and amendments of the Bio-waste Challenge Call. The project is implemented by UNDP in cooperaiton with the Ministry for Environmental Protection in Serbia.

UNDP has applied for 5 million SEK to carry out the project "Climate Smart Bio-Waste Management Challenge" in Serbia during the period 2019-2022. The intervention aim at promoting innovative projects and business solutions for climate-smart management of biodegradable waste (bio-waste), including food waste from households, businesses and industries, and green waste from parks and gardens. The expected result is a smaller quantity of bio waste disposed on landfills that leads to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions. The expected outputs are: 1) An Innovation Challenge Call for proposals for bio-waste conducted, 2) New innovative technical and systemic solutions and business models contributing to reduction of bio-waste which is disposed on the landfills, successfully implemented, and 3) Capacities and strategic communication related to bio waste management strengthened on all levels. UNDP will implement the activity together with the Ministry of Environmental Protection, and consultancy support to companies and other actors. The projects total budget is 5 million SEK.

UNDP har ansökt om finansiering från Sida med 5 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet "Climate Smart Bio-Waste Management Challenge" (Utmaningsdriven klimatinnovation för ökad biologisk återvinning) i Serbien under perioden 2019-2022. Insatsen har som övergripande mål att främja innovativa projekt och företagslösningar för att klimatsmart hantera biologiskt avfall och öka biologisk avfallsåtervinning, särskilt köksavfall, trädgårdsavfall och industriavfall från matindustrin. Genom att förbättra hanteringen av biologiskt avfall syftar insatsen till att bidra till minskad klimatpåverkan. Projektets tre delmål är att 1) Göra en innovationsdriven utlysning till stöd för klimatsmarta projekt och företagslösningar 2) Genomföra klimatsmarta projekt för att minska biologiskt avfall till deponi 3) Bygga kapacitet och strategisk kommunikation relaterad till biologiskt avfall.
UNDP kommer att genomföra aktiviteten tillsammans med Miljöministeriet i Serbien, samt genom konsultstöd till företag och andra aktörer. Projektet syftar även till att bidra till att bygga bredare relationer med svensk expertis inom området och företagsutveckling. Projektet har en total budget på 5 miljoner SEK.

tag.narrative: 12.3 - By 2030, halve per capita global food waste at the retail and consumer levels and reduce food losses along production and supply chains, including post-harvest losses.
12.3 - Till 2030, halvera det globala matsvinnet per person i butik- och konsumentledet, och minska matsvinnet längs hela livsmedelskedjan, även förlusterna efter skörd.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Agreement amendment UNDP-Sweden Climate Smart Bio-waste Management Challenge

description.narrative: During the first year of the projects the Challenge call for proposals of business solutions and innovative projects have been launched, and a list of around eight candidates have been selected for possible co-financing. The first year of the project has also given high priority to communication activities, reaching out to the public, to companies and authorities to strengthen the knowledge and engagement in bio-waste management. For example Instagram competitions took place during the lock down of the pandemic with a great participation form citizens. The Serbian Ministry for Environmental Protection has actively participated, for example in identifying key policy topics to follow up on in order to prepare for a larger bio-waste management reform. During the fall 2020 online meetings have been set up with Swedish business community to share experiences and identify further areas of cooperation and business development.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
